reasoning: Mammary gland tumors include both benign (fibroadenomas, papillomas) and malignant (breast cancers) neoplasms. Global breast cancer incidence is 40-50 per 100k in women; including benign tumors increases aggregate to ~60 per 100k. Primarily affects women. Data quality is strong for cancer component but includes considerable uncertainty for benign lesions.
source: GLOBOCAN 2012 for breast cancer; benign tumor estimates from epidemiological surveys
